translated: Elder’s Birth Stories
The Chapter with Sobhita
The Elder Sālapupphadāyaka’s Birth Story
“I was a king of deer then,
born in a good family, with beautiful antlers;
Searching for a difficult-to-find mountain,
I saw the Leader of the World.
‘This is a great hero,
who will liberate the great people;
Why don’t I attend on him,
the god of gods, the bull among men?’
Breaking off a branch of a sāla tree,
I took a flower with its stalk;
Approaching the Buddha,
I gave him the supreme flower.
For ninety-one eons,
the flower I offered;
I do not recall any bad destination,
this is the fruit of giving flowers.

analyzed: itas ca navame kappe  virocana sanāmakā
translated: And in the ninth eon from now,
there will be three kings named Virocana;
they will be powerful wheel-turning kings.
The four analytical knowledges …
… the Buddha’s instruction has been fulfilled.”🔽Thus spoke the Elder Sālapupphadāyaka, and after speaking,

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā sālapupphadāyako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Sālapupphadāyakattherassāpadānaṁ navamaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā sālapupphadāyakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽sālapupphadāyaka therassa apadānam navama
translated: The Elder Sālapupphadāyaka’s Birth Story, the ninth.
